Officially, I didn't cut the release, due to the announcement event has been cancelled considering COVID.

Back to this, if there is proxy-side plugin, ShardingSphere community should consider whether we should host the plugin by ourselves, rather than in SkyWalking repository. Because at there, we have to rely on their releasing period. Also, self-hosting means you could package the agent core and required plugins into your binary, users could be able to activate the agent by adding a system env or command argument.

Today, DolphinScheduler and Seata host the plugins(server-side mostly) on their own.

@wj-li This statement seems to be a paging subquery, and a complex aggregate query is performed internally. ShardingSphere currently cannot support the logical processing of aggregate query within the subquery.

```sql
SELECT *
FROM (
	SELECT TMP.*, ROWNUM AS ROW_ID
	FROM (
		SELECT TO_CHAR(STATIS_TIME, 'yyyy-mm-dd') AS statisTimeStr, BUSINESS_NO AS businessNo, BUSINESS_TYPE AS businessType
			, BANK_ID AS bankId, SUM(TOTAL_AMOUNT) AS totalAmount
		FROM T_DATA_STATIS
		WHERE BANK_ID IN (?)
			AND STATIS_TIME >= ?
			AND STATIS_TIME <= ?
		GROUP BY TO_CHAR(STATIS_TIME, 'yyyy-mm-dd'), BUSINESS_NO, BANK_ID, BUSINESS_TYPE, TOTAL_AMOUNT
	) TMP
	WHERE ROWNUM <= ?
)
WHERE ROW_ID > ?
```
